circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery:
On 3/18/73, the decedent was found near Logandale, Nevada just west of Bauman Reservation. It was estimated that he had been buried at this location for about 5-10 years.

It was noted that several years prior to this discovery, there were two migrant camps located in the vicinity of the pond near Logandale: The Jess Whipple Migrant Camp and the Wells Migrant Camp. A great variety of people lived in these camps, with various ethnic backgrounds including Mexican, Indian, etc. It is possible that somone from one of these camps died and was buried in the nearby area.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description:
Left thoracotomy scar, 17 inches long, commencing at the left sternal border and extends laterally and posteriorly to the interscapluar area of the back. 
There was a 4" scar on the base of the left side of the neck, above and roughly parallel to the clavicle.
There were two small apparent drain scars present in the left lateral chest.

Right upper arm had a very faint and very crude tattoo consisting of a series of dots that had a roughly oval shape measuring 2" high and 1.5" wide, with no specific pattern.
Extensor surface of the right forearm has a small tattoo of the initials WR.
Small heart tattooed on the extensor aspect of the right wrist.

circumstances.description: Desert area just east of US 93 at mile marker 66
circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Skeletal remains were originally found scattered in a desert area just east of US highway 93 at mile marker 66 by Red Rock Search and Rescue on January 12, 2019, and reported them to Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department (LVMPD) on January 14th. LVMPD scheduled a search for January 15th, however due to heavy rain the search was postponed until the area had time to dry out. On January 30th, 2019, anthropologists from the Clark County Office of the Coroner/Medical Examiner accompanied LVMPD and collected the remains after determining that they were in fact human.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On 09/17/1983, these skeletal remains were discovered in a desert wash at the west end of Ann Rd. A .22 semi-automatic pistol was recovered from the scene. Based on clothing recovered, it is believed that the decedent's death took place during the winter time. It was suggested that during the decedent's younger years he was probably around 5'10" but due to severe arthritis, his stature at the time of his death was around 5'8". The decedent also had extensive gold bridgework and numerous porcelain facings that would have been very expensive.

There were two intravenous solutions hanging from the shower rod attached to an IV in the decedent's right arm.  There was a suicide note dated 08/11/1999 in the motel room.  The decedent registered the room under the name "Carlos F. Otero" which was ficticious.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: The decedent was reportedly found at an unknown location in Reno in 1999 in an altered level of consciousness.  The decedent has been living in group homes since that time.  She has given various stories of having lived in Texas, and Las Vegas.  She has been using the name, Diane Ashley,  with multiple birth dates, and social security numbers, none of which are associated with that name.  She gave a story of being assaulted and left in the snow, which resulted  in bilateral lower leg amputations.  She gives her race as white, but she could be Native American, or Asian.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery:
On 05/21/1979, the operator of a tractor was engaged in excavating for a septic tank when he discovered skeletal remains approximately 5 feet below the surface. The skeleton is essentially complete.  
Information received from various persons indicated that in the mid-1950's, a number of African American people had been imported into the valley as farm laborers. Racial difficulties had developed, and it is believed that this skeleton might represent one of the laborers.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Two long bones (tibia and fibula) were recovered from the rural desert area believed to be somewhere in Clark County by visiting hikers from Florida. The hikers took the bones and returned home in Florida. The hikers reportedly saw an episode of America's Most Wanted and thought the bones might have something to do with a case of a 16 year old boy in which all but a leg bone had been recovered. The bones were taken to the Pinellas Co. Sheriff's Office in Florida and were given to their Medical Examiner's office, who in turn notified and returned the bones to our office.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On 07/16/1980 at 0926 hours, the decedent reportedly robbed a savings and loan bank and then left the scene driving a stolen vehicle.  The decedent was located by local police (Sparks Police Department) and a high speed pursuit was initiated.  The decedent and law enforcement reached speeds in excess of 100 mph before the decedent lost control of the vehicle, leaving the roadway, overturning multiple times.  The decedent was ejected and was transported by ambulance to the local hospital where he was pronounced dead in the Emergency Room. The location of the accident was approximately 10.5 miles east of the Reno/Sparks area.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: On 03/17/2015, a passerby was walking in the area of Lone Mountain, near the Lone Mountain Cemetery (Carson City, Nevada), when he observed the decedent's tennis shoe sticking out of an apparent shallow grave.  Emergency personnel responded to the scene, used a knife to cut the shoe, and observed that the decedent's foot was inside of the shoe.  Emergency personnel excavated the decedent from a shallow grave.  The decedent was fully clothed, and skeletonized with attached tissue.

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description:
Found in close proximity to where the remains were recovered:
a black "Skyway" canvas bag that contained a "Realistic" walkman tape player with headphones, the glasses listed above, and a silver "M. Hohner Blues Harp" harmonica. A black "Aqualite" wrist watch with a black plastic band was also found in the area. Numerous bottles (some full, some empty) of aspirin and sleep aid was also found.

Found in close proximity to where the remains were recovered: 
Grey jacket "David Taylor" size M, 
a blue short sleeve "Umbro" t-shirt size L

Found in close proximity to where the remains were recovered:
a "Wal-Mart" glasses case with 2 pairs of prescription eyeglasses

physicalDescription.headHairDescription: Estimated to be around 7 inches long at time of death

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Decedent had a relatively narrowed, squared chin
